app.title: SDG Indicator 15.4.2 - Mountain Green Cover Index (MGCI) (BETA)

ui.title: Re-classify custom LC/LU classes
ui.description: This module will help you to translate your own land cover / land user (LC/LU) maps into a custom classification. </br></br> In the following input cell you can select the assets stored in your Google Earth Engine account, you can use whether raster (image) or feature collection (table) assets, click over the 'Get attributes' button and a table will show up lettting you select the corresponding class.

error.no_code_col: Please select at least one column name or band.

veg_layer.title: Vegetation descriptor layer
veg_layer.description:
The vegetation descriptor layer categorizes land cover into green and non-green areas. Green vegetation includes both natural vegetation and vegetation resulting from anthropic activity (e.g. crops, afforestation, etc.). Non-green areas include very sparsely vegetated areas, bare land, water, permanent ice/snow and urban areas.

This module computes a vegetation descriptor layer using a land use/land cover map as an input. You have the option to use a custom land use/land cover map for your country. If not available, the tool will use a land cover time series produced by the European Space Agency (ESA) under the Climate Change Initiative (CCI) (Available at: ESA CCI viewer )

dashboard.title: MGCI calculation
dashboard.description: Calculate the Mountain Green Cover Index dashboard, the result will include an overall index for all the Kapos mountain classes and also a more detailed index for each of these classes.

report.title: Download report
report.description:
By exporting tables, the app will create three outputs.
  • ER_MTN_GRNCOV: Mountain green cover area ({1}).
  • ER_MTN_GRNCVI: Mountain Green Cover Index.
  • ER_MTN_TOTL: Total mountain area (in {1})
report.disabled_alert: The export button will be available once you have calculated the MGCI report.

tasks.title: MGCI calculation on background
tasks.description: This tab will help you to download the results file required to get the dashboard with the MGCI. You can track the progress of your task in the GEE tasks tracker, and once it is done, you can select whether the task id given in the calculation tab or use the tasks file which is stored in the '{}' folder.

alert.computing: Calculating MGCI values, using {}. This process could take a few minutes.
alert.tasks_failed: Due to computation timed out in GEE, the statistics couldn't be completed on the fly. However, the process has been sent to GEE under the name '{}'. You can track its progress in tasks tracker. Once it is completed, you will be able to use use the {} file in the 'Calculation from task' tab to generate the report.
alert.tasks_rsa: The calculation is being executed in GEE under the name '{}', you can track its progress in tasks tracker. Once the process is complete, you will be able to use use the {} file in the 'Calculation from task' tab to generate the report.
alert.no_summary: It seems like you have not calculated the MGCI. Please calculate it before trying to export the results.
